Overview

In this iteration of my website for web development frameworks, I implemented an email contact form using a serverless function hosted on Vercel. For the mail service, I chose Mailgun based on my professor's recommendation and some additional research, which showed it to be one of the simplest options to set up. Before integrating the mail service, I created a basic contact form containing all the necessary fields for sending an email. Once the form was functional, I styled it using Bootstrap classes to ensure it was visually appealing and user-friendly. After finalizing the form, I followed Mailgun's tutorial for setting up SMTP transactions and attempted to connect it to their domain. The backend implementation was straightforward by web development standards. It involved structuring the data and transmitting it to the recipient over the internet. Now, the email functionality is not fully operational. There might be an issue with my Mailgun account, as it could still be under administrative review or blocked. Iâ€™m working on resolving this so the email feature can function as intended.
